tip.cred1: Get a refresh token via the steps below. Note that only the App Key and the Refresh Token will be stored in Node-RED, to minimize security issues. It is highly advised to execute the below steps across an SSL connection to Node-RED!
tip.cred2: Sign up for an account on Dropbox.
tip.cred3: Create a new app on Dropbox developer home. On the subsequent page, select 'Dropbox API app' and choose App folder or Full Dropbox access. And set the required app permissions.
tip.cred4: Copy both the 'app key' and 'app secret' from that page to here:
tip.cred5: Start an (OAuth2) authentication flow to obtain an access code.
tip.cred6: If no popup window appears, it might be necessary to instruct the browser to allow popup windows for this website.
tip.cred7: The first time the authentication flow is executed, Dropbox will ask to confirm (via two subsequent pages) that this app has access to your Dropbox files.
tip.cred8: Copy the access code from the last popup window of the authentication flow to here:
tip.cred9: Use this access code to request a new refresh token.
tip.cred10: Every time the app permissions are changed afterwards, it is required to revoke the refresh token and to repeat steps 4 and 5 again. Otherwise the refresh token will continue operating with the original permissions.

info.refresh-token-generated: The refresh token has been generated and copied already automatically to the 'Refresh Token' input field.

error.auth-url-failed: failed to determine redirect auth url
